blog.name: ao3feed-clintxnat
blog.title: love is for children, i owe him a debt.
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of all fic posted on the Archive Of Our Own under the Clint Barton/Natasha Romanov pairing tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed using an IFTTT recipe, but this was made easy thanks to astolat (astolat.tumblr.com). If you would like to set up a similar blog, see the instructions tab :) To check announcements regarding these blogs, go to the tumblr tag #ao3feed announcement. (moderated by enjolbutt.tumblr.com) I hope this blog helps when you are in dire need of feels or a laugh, so enjoy! :)

title: Heatbeats
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2wmBmjs

by BayleyWinchester

The world had collapsed so quickly.

Within weeks the world had been overrun with the infected. You were just trying to stay alive. Trying to keep your heart beating.

You never thought that, during the apocalypse of all places, you’d be able to fall in love.

summary: Tony’s Daughter - Part 2
title: Tony’s Daughter - Part 2
body:
Summary: Tony Stark had a secret daughter, one which he had hidden from the world due to her supernatural abilities. When she turned 20, she begged her father to let her join the Avengers. Little did he know that, in agreeing to this, he was introducing her to the man she would grow to love.

Part 1, Part 3, Part 4, Part 5, Part 6, Part 7 (End)

(Steve Rogers x Reader, Tony Stark (Dad) x Reader)

Warnings: Mild sexual implications, Mild swearing

Word Count: 1,300

Requested by: @xxchloegrayxx

A/N: Thank you for the love on the first part of this series! I hope you enjoy this part just as much!

It had been two years since she first set foot in the Avengers building. A lot had changed since that day.

Just as Tony had hoped, Wanda and Vision had taken (Y/N) under their wing. They became like second parents to her. This didn’t bother either Tony nor Pepper, as Wanda and Vision understood (Y/N)’s powers better than they ever could. Wanda taught the younger girl how to control her abilities and how to use them for good. However, she still hadn’t experienced a battle, so hadn’t had the chance to test her skills. Tony was secretly pleased. He still saw his daughter as the sweet, innocent child he needed to protect. He was completely unaware of just how strong she was, but also about a certain other Avenger she had grown particularly fond of.

When (Y/N) first began training, she had been partnered with Wanda and Steve. Both had a different skill set they could teach her; Wanda with magic and Steve with combat. Where (Y/N) saw Wanda in a maternal way, she began to develop different feelings for the soldier. Group training sessions became late night private training with Steve. (Y/N) would have lessons with Wanda during the day, then sneak off to see Cap in the evenings. Wanda was the only Avenger who knew about these secret visits. That is until Peter walked in on the pair “training”.

“Holy mother of…!” Peter yelled, covering his eyes, as he entered the training room.

“Peter! Shit,” (Y/N) muttered. She and Steve were led on the floor of the gym, in a rather compromising position. Their gym session had gotten a little heated.

“Language,” Steve scolded. He grabbed his t-shirt, his cheeks flushing, while (Y/N) adjusted her sports bra.

“It’s 2 am, kid. What are you doing up?” Steve asked the teenager.

“I… I… I left my phone down here, so I came looking for it,” Peter stuttered. “Sorry for intruding guys.” He held up his hands in surrender, looking sheepish. He spotted his phone on a bench, grabbed it and ran from the room.

(Y/N) groaned, before flopping back on the floor. Steve slid back down to join her, wrapping his arm around her shoulders and pulling her close to him. He absentmindedly played with her hair, which had come loose. “There’s no way Peter can keep a secret from Dad. No way in hell.”

“We need to work on your cussing,” Steve chucked. (Y/N) looked up and scowled at him, which he met with a wink.

“Come on,” Steve got to his feet, holding a hand out for (Y/N), “Let’s get to bed. We can deal with Stark in the morning.”

(Y/N) groaned again and took his hand. She let herself be led from the room.

~

Tony willed it not to be true. “Can you repeat that again, Spidey.”

Peter stood in front of him, looking extremely embarrassed. “I… umm… I saw (Y/N) and the Captain in the gym and they were… umm… they were kissing and… stuff.”

The billionaire didn’t wait to hear anymore. He stormed out of the kitchen, slamming the door behind him. This was not the news he wanted to wake up to.

“I thought you should know,” Peter called after his boss. He bit his lip, considering that maybe he should have kept what he’d seen a secret.

It was still early, so most of the Avengers were still asleep. However, this was not the case when Tony went bellowing around the compound. “Hey, Capsicle! You wanna come out here?” he yelled, making his way down the corridor towards Cap’s bedroom. Bruce opened his door and looked around, confused. Natasha appeared behind him soon after. “What’s going on?” she yawned, rubbing her eyes.

“Tony’s on a rampage. Guessing he found out about (Y/N) and Steve,” Bruce responded.

Tony whipped around and charged at Bruce. “You knew about this?” he spat in the scientist’s face.

“Hey, calm down,” Nat held her hand up, “We don’t need the other guy making an appearance.”

Tony backed up and continued his pursuit of Steve. “I’ll deal with you later,” he called over his shoulder.

He reached Steve’s bedroom door and hammered on it with his fist. Without waiting for a response, he kicked the door open. Steve sat up just in time to see Tony advancing. He jumped back out of his bed. “Woah! What’s going on?”

Tony pinned Cap against the wall, his forearm pushing against his neck. “You know exactly what’s going on.”

At this point, Tony’s outburst had drawn the attention of the rest of the Avengers. They crowded around the door. Thor and Clint pushed their way through to split apart the two men. (Y/N) was late to the party, entering the room to see her dad and boyfriend being restrained.

“Oh god,” she whispered. It wasn’t quiet enough. Tony struggled in Thor’s tight hold when he heard (Y/N)’s voice.

“Let me go, Thor.” The god did as he was told. Tony turned to face his daughter. “Pete told me something interesting this morning, said he saw the two of you,” he gestured between (Y/N) and Steve, “doing ‘stuff’ last night in the training room.” He paused, his eyes boring into Steve’s. “Is that true?”

(Y/N) slowly nodded.

“How long’s this been going on for?”

“About a year,” Steve dared to speak up.

Tony rubbed his forehead, sighing. “I have nothing more to say, for now. But,” he pointed at (Y/N), “tell your mother.” (Y/N) nodded and Tony left the room, followed by the Avengers. They went back to whatever they were doing before the drama, leaving just (Y/N) and Steve.

“Looks like the secret is out,” Steve said. He said on the edge of the bed, gesturing for (Y/N) to join him. She shook her head.

“I can’t right now. Dad’s right, I need to talk to Mum.” She planted a gentle kiss on his lips before leaving for Stark Tower.

~

“So, she has a boyfriend? Isn’t that a good thing? She’s socialising, after an entire life hidden, I thought it would be near to impossible for her to just fit back into society,” Pepper reasoned with her husband as he paced about the lab.

“She kept this a secret for a year, Pep! A year! We raised her, kept her safe and she’s keeping secrets.” With one angry sweep of his arm, he pushed a load of test tubes and papers off of the nearest table. Pepper jumped back, as glass shattered everywhere.

“Dad?” (Y/N) appeared at the door. She was biting her nails, an old habit she hadn’t succeeded in giving up.

“Hey sweetie,” Pepper beamed, giving her daughter a hug. “Your father is in a mood. Why don’t we go have a girly chat?” she whispered in (Y/N)’s ear.

~

They sat on the sofa, sipping at hot chocolate and looking out over the city.

“So,” Pepper said, at last, “You at Captain America? How very rebellious of you.” She smiled.

“Yeah, it just kinda happened…” (Y/N) muttered. She knew Pepper wouldn’t react the same as Tony had, but she was still nervous.

Pepper put down her mug and leaned over to (Y/N). she squeezed her arm, “I’m happy for you, darling. Ignore your dad, he’s just being over-protective.” (Y/N) managed a half of a smile. It was hard enough transitioning into being an Avenger and suddenly being in the public eye, but having Tony mad at her was something she didn’t needed. Pepper noticed the worry in (Y/N)’s eyes. “He’ll come around. Go home. I’m sure he’ll have calmed down a little by tomorrow. I’ll have words,” she winked. “I’ll call the driver, he’ll take you home.”

“It’s okay,” (Y/N) said, “Steve is coming to get me.”

Pepper laughed, “For god’s sake don’t let Tony see.”

 Tag List: @edwisenpai @chibiyanai @alphaaddict @this-is-happening

He reached Steve’s bedroom door and hammered on it with his fist. Without waiting for a response, he kicked the door open. Steve sat up just in time to see Tony advancing. He jumped back out of his bed. “Woah! What’s going on?”

Tony pinned Cap against the wall, his forearm pushing against his neck. “You know exactly what’s going on.”

At this point, Tony’s outburst had drawn the attention of the rest of the Avengers. They crowded around the door. Thor and Clint pushed their way through to split apart the two men. (Y/N) was late to the party, entering the room to see her dad and boyfriend being restrained.

“Oh god,” she whispered. It wasn’t quiet enough. Tony struggled in Thor’s tight hold when he heard (Y/N)’s voice.

“Let me go, Thor.” The god did as he was told. Tony turned to face his daughter. “Pete told me something interesting this morning, said he saw the two of you,” he gestured between (Y/N) and Steve, “doing ‘stuff’ last night in the training room.” He paused, his eyes boring into Steve’s. “Is that true?”

(Y/N) slowly nodded.

“How long’s this been going on for?”

“About a year,” Steve dared to speak up.

Tony rubbed his forehead, sighing. “I have nothing more to say, for now. But,” he pointed at (Y/N), “tell your mother.” (Y/N) nodded and Tony left the room, followed by the Avengers. They went back to whatever they were doing before the drama, leaving just (Y/N) and Steve.

“Looks like the secret is out,” Steve said. He said on the edge of the bed, gesturing for (Y/N) to join him. She shook her head.

“I can’t right now. Dad’s right, I need to talk to Mum.” She planted a gentle kiss on his lips before leaving for Stark Tower.

~

“So, she has a boyfriend? Isn’t that a good thing? She’s socialising, after an entire life hidden, I thought it would be near to impossible for her to just fit back into society,” Pepper reasoned with her husband as he paced about the lab.

“She kept this a secret for a year, Pep! A year! We raised her, kept her safe and she’s keeping secrets.” With one angry sweep of his arm, he pushed a load of test tubes and papers off of the nearest table. Pepper jumped back, as glass shattered everywhere.

“Dad?” (Y/N) appeared at the door. She was biting her nails, an old habit she hadn’t succeeded in giving up.

“Hey sweetie,” Pepper beamed, giving her daughter a hug. “Your father is in a mood. Why don’t we go have a girly chat?” she whispered in (Y/N)’s ear.

~

They sat on the sofa, sipping at hot chocolate and looking out over the city.

“So,” Pepper said, at last, “You at Captain America? How very rebellious of you.” She smiled.

“Yeah, it just kinda happened…” (Y/N) muttered. She knew Pepper wouldn’t react the same as Tony had, but she was still nervous.

Pepper put down her mug and leaned over to (Y/N). she squeezed her arm, “I’m happy for you, darling. Ignore your dad, he’s just being over-protective.” (Y/N) managed a half of a smile. It was hard enough transitioning into being an Avenger and suddenly being in the public eye, but having Tony mad at her was something she didn’t needed. Pepper noticed the worry in (Y/N)’s eyes. “He’ll come around. Go home. I’m sure he’ll have calmed down a little by tomorrow. I’ll have words,” she winked. “I’ll call the driver, he’ll take you home.”

“It’s okay,” (Y/N) said, “Steve is coming to get me.”

Pepper laughed, “For god’s sake don’t let Tony see.”

Summary: Tony Stark had a secret daughter, one which he had hidden from the world due to her supernatural abilities. When she turned 20, she begged her father to let her join the Avengers. Little did he know that, in agreeing to this, he was introducing her to the man she would grow to love.

Part 1, Part 3, Part 4, Part 5, Part 6, Part 7 (End)

(Steve Rogers x Reader, Tony Stark (Dad) x Reader)

Warnings: Mild sexual implications, Mild swearing

Word Count: 1,300

Requested by: @xxchloegrayxx

A/N: Thank you for the love on the first part of this series! I hope you enjoy this part just as much!

It had been two years since she first set foot in the Avengers building. A lot had changed since that day.

Just as Tony had hoped, Wanda and Vision had taken (Y/N) under their wing. They became like second parents to her. This didn’t bother either Tony nor Pepper, as Wanda and Vision understood (Y/N)’s powers better than they ever could. Wanda taught the younger girl how to control her abilities and how to use them for good. However, she still hadn’t experienced a battle, so hadn’t had the chance to test her skills. Tony was secretly pleased. He still saw his daughter as the sweet, innocent child he needed to protect. He was completely unaware of just how strong she was, but also about a certain other Avenger she had grown particularly fond of.

When (Y/N) first began training, she had been partnered with Wanda and Steve. Both had a different skill set they could teach her; Wanda with magic and Steve with combat. Where (Y/N) saw Wanda in a maternal way, she began to develop different feelings for the soldier. Group training sessions became late night private training with Steve. (Y/N) would have lessons with Wanda during the day, then sneak off to see Cap in the evenings. Wanda was the only Avenger who knew about these secret visits. That is until Peter walked in on the pair “training”.

“Holy mother of…!” Peter yelled, covering his eyes, as he entered the training room.

“Peter! Shit,” (Y/N) muttered. She and Steve were led on the floor of the gym, in a rather compromising position. Their gym session had gotten a little heated.

“Language,” Steve scolded. He grabbed his t-shirt, his cheeks flushing, while (Y/N) adjusted her sports bra.

“It’s 2 am, kid. What are you doing up?” Steve asked the teenager.

“I… I… I left my phone down here, so I came looking for it,” Peter stuttered. “Sorry for intruding guys.” He held up his hands in surrender, looking sheepish. He spotted his phone on a bench, grabbed it and ran from the room.

(Y/N) groaned, before flopping back on the floor. Steve slid back down to join her, wrapping his arm around her shoulders and pulling her close to him. He absentmindedly played with her hair, which had come loose. “There’s no way Peter can keep a secret from Dad. No way in hell.”

“We need to work on your cussing,” Steve chucked. (Y/N) looked up and scowled at him, which he met with a wink.

“Come on,” Steve got to his feet, holding a hand out for (Y/N), “Let’s get to bed. We can deal with Stark in the morning.”

(Y/N) groaned again and took his hand. She let herself be led from the room.

~

Tony willed it not to be true. “Can you repeat that again, Spidey.”

Peter stood in front of him, looking extremely embarrassed. “I… umm… I saw (Y/N) and the Captain in the gym and they were… umm… they were kissing and… stuff.”

The billionaire didn’t wait to hear anymore. He stormed out of the kitchen, slamming the door behind him. This was not the news he wanted to wake up to.

“I thought you should know,” Peter called after his boss. He bit his lip, considering that maybe he should have kept what he’d seen a secret.

It was still early, so most of the Avengers were still asleep. However, this was not the case when Tony went bellowing around the compound. “Hey, Capsicle! You wanna come out here?” he yelled, making his way down the corridor towards Cap’s bedroom. Bruce opened his door and looked around, confused. Natasha appeared behind him soon after. “What’s going on?” she yawned, rubbing her eyes.

“Tony’s on a rampage. Guessing he found out about (Y/N) and Steve,” Bruce responded.

Tony whipped around and charged at Bruce. “You knew about this?” he spat in the scientist’s face.

“Hey, calm down,” Nat held her hand up, “We don’t need the other guy making an appearance.”

Tony backed up and continued his pursuit of Steve. “I’ll deal with you later,” he called over his shoulder.

He reached Steve’s bedroom door and hammered on it with his fist. Without waiting for a response, he kicked the door open. Steve sat up just in time to see Tony advancing. He jumped back out of his bed. “Woah! What’s going on?”

Tony pinned Cap against the wall, his forearm pushing against his neck. “You know exactly what’s going on.”

At this point, Tony’s outburst had drawn the attention of the rest of the Avengers. They crowded around the door. Thor and Clint pushed their way through to split apart the two men. (Y/N) was late to the party, entering the room to see her dad and boyfriend being restrained.

“Oh god,” she whispered. It wasn’t quiet enough. Tony struggled in Thor’s tight hold when he heard (Y/N)’s voice.

“Let me go, Thor.” The god did as he was told. Tony turned to face his daughter. “Pete told me something interesting this morning, said he saw the two of you,” he gestured between (Y/N) and Steve, “doing ‘stuff’ last night in the training room.” He paused, his eyes boring into Steve’s. “Is that true?”

(Y/N) slowly nodded.

“How long’s this been going on for?”

“About a year,” Steve dared to speak up.

Tony rubbed his forehead, sighing. “I have nothing more to say, for now. But,” he pointed at (Y/N), “tell your mother.” (Y/N) nodded and Tony left the room, followed by the Avengers. They went back to whatever they were doing before the drama, leaving just (Y/N) and Steve.

“Looks like the secret is out,” Steve said. He said on the edge of the bed, gesturing for (Y/N) to join him. She shook her head.

“I can’t right now. Dad’s right, I need to talk to Mum.” She planted a gentle kiss on his lips before leaving for Stark Tower.

~

body:
Subject 302 (Avengers x Young!Assassin!Reader) Part 1

Summary: Subject 302 had spent her entire childhood in a HYDRA Facility.

Her mother was also a test subject of HYDRA’s who had gotten pregnant when she obviously wasn’t supposed to. They took her from her mother the second she was out of the womb, killed the mother afterwards.

Since then, she has been injected, probed, cut, and put back together, over and over again. She was then proclaimed as the youngest out of many of HYDRA’s assassin.

Warning: Violence, mentions of blood and torture

———

Screams of terror.

That’s all you’re familiar to. Whether it’s someone else’s or your own. Sixteen years of your life was filled with it. You may be young but your soul was anything but that, it was dead, for as long as you can remember.

You watched as the middle aged man fell limp in front of you, terror filled his eyes, open but lifeless. Fresh blood was still pouring from the open slash on his neck.

Just another casuality of a much bigger war, you thought as you slipped your knife back to it’s holster. You turned around to leave the scene, stepping over a few more dead bodies on your way.

Digging for information was never really your thing, you were more of the ‘shoot first ask questions later’ type of person, that was what your Creators taught you.

So far the only information you had was that The Winter Soldier is now living at The Avengers HQ. Not that you didn’t already know that, but you can’t just go and attack a building filled with superhumans and is designed to keep villains out. You needed a better plan and that plan is still yet to be made.

So here you were, coming up to anyone your Creators believed had any connection of any kind to the Avengers, and whether they don’t tell you what you need to know or they do, you kill them. It’s been like that for almost a year now. And no one ever told you what you needed to know. Well until now.

You had received information that in two days a GALA ball will be held by Stark Industries, and the Avengers were going to be there. It was a fairly public event, as long as you know someone who knows someone, you’ll get in.

You went back to your base, reported your findings to your Creators and soon you were told what your next move would be. You were to attend the event along with them.

One a man, a soldier that goes by the name of Stanislav. The other one was a woman, Tatyana, a scientist who worked both on you and The Winter Soldier. Hoping that the magical mantra would be able to turn the good Bucky Barnes back to the evil Winter Soldier without causing too much commotion. They –along with you, were the only bits of HYDRA left after the destruction.

—————-

As the driver pulled up to the venue, you braced yourself for the amount of people present. Even from afar you can hear how loud it was, and when you were finally there you saw dozens of reporters, cameramen, and the flashes of their cameras bring back memories. Not good ones of course.

Your small frame was curled up in to a ball in the corner of your cell. Another sleepless night had passed and you were once again faced by the horrifying reality.

The metal door opened with a bang, making you flinch as a few tears run down your face.

“Get up.” The man said in Russian, one out of twenty two languages you had managed to cram inside your three year old brain.

When you didn’t budge, he picked you up with ease. You didn’t even fight, you knew there was no use. On the way to the examination room, you passed a glass cell where a man sat solemnly. He was the only person you’ve ever seen aside from the soldiers and the scientists. You knew he was neither of them, or at least he didn’t look like one.

The star imprinted on his metal arm fascinates your somewhat innocent brain for a reason you didn’t know. You stared at the star and caught his eyes, he was staring back at you for a couple of seconds before he went out of your line of sight.

The man carrying you stepped in to a sickeningly clean white room and strapped you in a chair. You whined and sobbed but he only gave you a disgusted look.

“Good morning, child,” said a woman from the other side of the room, your ‘Doctor’. “Ready for today?”

The man put another strap over your mouth, you bite in to it out of instinct. You struggled to break free, the strap muffled your screams of protest. Just then the machine turned on, the blinding light in front of you flashes in a pattern that changes everyday, the seat started to shake as your small body was shocked with electricity just below the rate where it will kill you. You cried, and cried, but it was no use.

By the time you really snapped out of your trance, you were already inside the venue. You’ve never been in the middle of this much people before, it feels weird.

It wasn’t long until the three of you spotted the Avengers bunch in the VIP Lounge. Your Creators entered the VIP Lounge with ease as you were told to stay put and be on alert. And as always, you complied.

The plan was to separate Barnes from the others, or at least most of them. How? You weren’t told, so it was not your problem. You were only told to chime in if the situation gets out of hand.

Just then you heard a crash followed by shouting. Seems like the situation just got out of hand.

You acted quickly and jumped over the gate to the lounge and you saw the Winter Soldier out cold, not far from him was Tatyana, reciting the trigger words. A few meters away was a man you recognized as The Falcon, fighting his way to get to his friend, but without his suit he was struggling to win over the armed former HYDRA soldier.

The other Avengers were no where in sight, but it won’t be long until they get here. You must act fast.

You went to take on The Falcon and signalled to Stanislav to go help with Barnes. As you stood in front of the man, he was already out of breath with bruises on his face. He looked confused as to why a child was in front of him in the middle of this dangerous situation.

“Who are you?” He asked.

You didn’t answer, instead you pushed him back against a wall. He struggled on your grasp but you didn’t let go. You melted a piece of window railing in your reach, burning your glove and exposing your vibranium arm in process. You stuck his hand in to the scorching hot metal and he screamed in pain. You held it in place as the metal turned back cold and hard, locking the hero’s hand along with it.

By the time you were done with him and you spun around, your two Creators were no where to be seen and so was The Winter Soldier. Instead, about half of the Earth’s mightiest heroes came swarming the room.

“Sam!” One of them shouted, Captain America.

You felt like a trapped animal, ready to attack. You ripped the remaining fabric of your dress’ sleeves to make it easier to move as you eyed your opponents. The vibranium arms you’ve had for the last six years caught the eyes of the heroes in front of you.

“Oh, shit.” Another man remarked upon seeing your arms, a suitless Iron Man.

“Who are you?” The Black Widow asked.

Again, you didn’t answer. You attacked, like what you were trained to do. The closest to you was The Black Widow, it was fairly easy for you to win over her if it wasn’t for the fact it was a four versus one fight.

Just when you got her in a choke hold, seconds away from breaking her neck, Iron Man threw you off of Romanoff as his suit attached itself to him, you flew and hit the wall leaving a dent, but you weren’t phased at all.

Captain America turned his attention from helping Wilson to you, leaving Vision to try and get him out. At the same time, Iron Man was also approaching. You avoided him just by a few inches and grabbed on to his suit, getting your powers to the maximum level in order to melt the metal.

“This is bringing back bad memories,” you heard him comment as the suit started to crumble under your fingers.

On your right you saw Captain America running towards you with shield in hand, you threw Iron Man towards him, sending both backwards from the impact.

Just then, you saw an open way to a window, that was your chance to take your leave. You started to bolt to the window but Vision shot his laser just a foot away from you.

You jumped at him, trying to get him to set foot and it worked. As soon as he landed you tried to melt whatever that thing was on his forehead that shoots laser.

You haven’t even touched the yellow stone when you felt someone creeping up behind you. You turned to be greeted by Scarlet Witch, who was not present before. You were about to attack when she put her hand on your forehead sending you deep in to sleep.

Part 2

That’s all you’re familiar to. Whether it’s someone else’s or your own. Sixteen years of your life was filled with it. You may be young but your soul was anything but that, it was dead, for as long as you can remember.

You watched as the middle aged man fell limp in front of you, terror filled his eyes, open but lifeless. Fresh blood was still pouring from the open slash on his neck.

Just another casuality of a much bigger war, you thought as you slipped your knife back to it’s holster. You turned around to leave the scene, stepping over a few more dead bodies on your way.

Digging for information was never really your thing, you were more of the ‘shoot first ask questions later’ type of person, that was what your Creators taught you.

So far the only information you had was that The Winter Soldier is now living at The Avengers HQ. Not that you didn’t already know that, but you can’t just go and attack a building filled with superhumans and is designed to keep villains out. You needed a better plan and that plan is still yet to be made.

So here you were, coming up to anyone your Creators believed had any connection of any kind to the Avengers, and whether they don’t tell you what you need to know or they do, you kill them. It’s been like that for almost a year now. And no one ever told you what you needed to know. Well until now.

You had received information that in two days a GALA ball will be held by Stark Industries, and the Avengers were going to be there. It was a fairly public event, as long as you know someone who knows someone, you’ll get in.

You went back to your base, reported your findings to your Creators and soon you were told what your next move would be. You were to attend the event along with them.

One a man, a soldier that goes by the name of Stanislav. The other one was a woman, Tatyana, a scientist who worked both on you and The Winter Soldier. Hoping that the magical mantra would be able to turn the good Bucky Barnes back to the evil Winter Soldier without causing too much commotion. They –along with you, were the only bits of HYDRA left after the destruction.

—————-

As the driver pulled up to the venue, you braced yourself for the amount of people present. Even from afar you can hear how loud it was, and when you were finally there you saw dozens of reporters, cameramen, and the flashes of their cameras bring back memories. Not good ones of course.

Your small frame was curled up in to a ball in the corner of your cell. Another sleepless night had passed and you were once again faced by the horrifying reality.

The metal door opened with a bang, making you flinch as a few tears run down your face.

“Get up.” The man said in Russian, one out of twenty two languages you had managed to cram inside your three year old brain.

When you didn’t budge, he picked you up with ease. You didn’t even fight, you knew there was no use. On the way to the examination room, you passed a glass cell where a man sat solemnly. He was the only person you’ve ever seen aside from the soldiers and the scientists. You knew he was neither of them, or at least he didn’t look like one.

The star imprinted on his metal arm fascinates your somewhat innocent brain for a reason you didn’t know. You stared at the star and caught his eyes, he was staring back at you for a couple of seconds before he went out of your line of sight.

The man carrying you stepped in to a sickeningly clean white room and strapped you in a chair. You whined and sobbed but he only gave you a disgusted look.

“Good morning, child,” said a woman from the other side of the room, your ‘Doctor’. “Ready for today?”

The man put another strap over your mouth, you bite in to it out of instinct. You struggled to break free, the strap muffled your screams of protest. Just then the machine turned on, the blinding light in front of you flashes in a pattern that changes everyday, the seat started to shake as your small body was shocked with electricity just below the rate where it will kill you. You cried, and cried, but it was no use.

By the time you really snapped out of your trance, you were already inside the venue. You’ve never been in the middle of this much people before, it feels weird.

It wasn’t long until the three of you spotted the Avengers bunch in the VIP Lounge. Your Creators entered the VIP Lounge with ease as you were told to stay put and be on alert. And as always, you complied.

The plan was to separate Barnes from the others, or at least most of them. How? You weren’t told, so it was not your problem. You were only told to chime in if the situation gets out of hand.

Just then you heard a crash followed by shouting. Seems like the situation just got out of hand.

You acted quickly and jumped over the gate to the lounge and you saw the Winter Soldier out cold, not far from him was Tatyana, reciting the trigger words. A few meters away was a man you recognized as The Falcon, fighting his way to get to his friend, but without his suit he was struggling to win over the armed former HYDRA soldier.

The other Avengers were no where in sight, but it won’t be long until they get here. You must act fast.

You went to take on The Falcon and signalled to Stanislav to go help with Barnes. As you stood in front of the man, he was already out of breath with bruises on his face. He looked confused as to why a child was in front of him in the middle of this dangerous situation.

“Who are you?” He asked.

You didn’t answer, instead you pushed him back against a wall. He struggled on your grasp but you didn’t let go. You melted a piece of window railing in your reach, burning your glove and exposing your vibranium arm in process. You stuck his hand in to the scorching hot metal and he screamed in pain. You held it in place as the metal turned back cold and hard, locking the hero’s hand along with it.

By the time you were done with him and you spun around, your two Creators were no where to be seen and so was The Winter Soldier. Instead, about half of the Earth’s mightiest heroes came swarming the room.

“Sam!” One of them shouted, Captain America.

You felt like a trapped animal, ready to attack. You ripped the remaining fabric of your dress’ sleeves to make it easier to move as you eyed your opponents. The vibranium arms you’ve had for the last six years caught the eyes of the heroes in front of you.

“Oh, shit.” Another man remarked upon seeing your arms, a suitless Iron Man.

“Who are you?” The Black Widow asked.

Again, you didn’t answer. You attacked, like what you were trained to do. The closest to you was The Black Widow, it was fairly easy for you to win over her if it wasn’t for the fact it was a four versus one fight.

Just when you got her in a choke hold, seconds away from breaking her neck, Iron Man threw you off of Romanoff as his suit attached itself to him, you flew and hit the wall leaving a dent, but you weren’t phased at all.

Captain America turned his attention from helping Wilson to you, leaving Vision to try and get him out. At the same time, Iron Man was also approaching. You avoided him just by a few inches and grabbed on to his suit, getting your powers to the maximum level in order to melt the metal.

“This is bringing back bad memories,” you heard him comment as the suit started to crumble under your fingers.

On your right you saw Captain America running towards you with shield in hand, you threw Iron Man towards him, sending both backwards from the impact.

Just then, you saw an open way to a window, that was your chance to take your leave. You started to bolt to the window but Vision shot his laser just a foot away from you.

You jumped at him, trying to get him to set foot and it worked. As soon as he landed you tried to melt whatever that thing was on his forehead that shoots laser.

You haven’t even touched the yellow stone when you felt someone creeping up behind you. You turned to be greeted by Scarlet Witch, who was not present before. You were about to attack when she put her hand on your forehead sending you deep in to sleep.

Part 2

Her mother was also a test subject of HYDRA’s who had gotten pregnant when she obviously wasn’t supposed to. They took her from her mother the second she was out of the womb, killed the mother afterwards.

Since then, she has been injected, probed, cut, and put back together, over and over again. She was then proclaimed as the youngest out of many of HYDRA’s assassin.

summary: IronStrange x Gravity Falls
body:
IronStrange x Gravity Falls

I love Gravity Falls

Best cartoon ever! (Also love Over The Garden Wall) (It’s tricky to choose between these two)

And as my head is a strange place I had an idea!

Imagine the teenage Avengers making a group trip to a very weird village during the summer.

There they meet a boy who can do magic and who fights mystical beings, a hut called SHIELD which is a tourist trap, the small enemies could be the villains of the MCU and Bill the Thanos (let’s not imagine Thanos doing things the way Bill did, please xD) and a summer romance between Stephen and Tony.

Imagine the possibilities *–*

summary: marvel characters as quotes from my school
title: marvel characters as quotes from my school
body:
Tony Stark: She just called me a little snail and I said thank you because fuck you I need love too.

Steve Rogers: Everyone thinks I’m like this sweet little angel but in my mind I’ve killed all of you twice with just what I can find in this room.

Bruce Banner: If I ever met a clone of myself, I’d murder him.

Thor Odinson: I try so hard to be that badass bitch you can’t kill but right now I really just want to go cry in the corner.

Natasha Romanov: Bitch, if you keep coughing through this god damn exam I will cut you. No, I won’t apologize for cursing. Can you at least send his ass outside? Or to a hospital? Oh, my God.

Clint Barton: Well, I’d love to have come earlier but I didn’t want to.

Loki Laufeyson/Odinson: Mark my words in a few years all you bitches will be kneeling before me.

Valkyrie: I’m seventeen and I want to get really really drunk right now.

Wanda Maximoff: I don’t know what I’m doing. I don’t know why I’m doing it and I don’t even know why I’m here.

Pietro Maximoff: I’ve been at superspeed running from my problems since I was born. I don’t need powers for that, y’all are just weak.

Vision: Hi, I don’t understand why people have to exist. What chapter covers how the world would be better without humans?

Peter Parker: I think I’m doing something wrong. I think- [loud crash], yeah, I definitely did something wrong.

Sam Wilson: If I just keep eating do you think all my worries will just disappear?

Shuri: I’m not a genius. You’re all just dumb.

Bucky Barnes: You know I was having a good time in bed this morning. My eyes were closed and I was basically dead to the world, but despite all that I came here today and I can honestly say it is currently my biggest regret in life.

summary: 原來我們看的《復仇者聯盟3》結局早被刪減？因為真正結局太血腥…
title: 原來我們看的《復仇者聯盟3》結局早被刪減？因為真正結局太血腥…
body:
《復仇者聯盟3－無限之戰》（Avengers3:Infinity War）被普遍認為是最悲傷的英雄片，一反主角總是贏家的官方結局，本片結尾不但有多位主要英雄人物「被消失」，反派 Thanos 甚至破天荒的達到了他的邪惡理想，不過這樣一個黑暗的結局，居然還是早已被更改過後的模樣？

根據《復仇者聯盟3》視覺效果總監 Dan DeLeeuw 透露，其實原本的結局應該是 Thanos 在奪取宇宙一大半人的性命之後，一個人若有所思的徒步走過象徵大多數生命滅絕後流出的鮮紅色「血河」，導演也相當喜歡這樣的畫面，但礙於本片電影分級制度是 13 歲以下需家長陪同觀看的「PG-13」，所以這樣的畫面被認為太過血腥，只好忍痛刪減，因此我們在電影院看到的版本其實是經過刪減調整後的畫面，並非完整的《復仇者聯盟3》結局，雖然還是不影響全片精采程度，但還是替導演感到可惜呀！

《復仇者聯盟3》又發現一彩蛋：這不起眼的一幕竟暗示驚奇隊長的訊息！

看著也面紅！Marvel 釋出爆笑 NG 片段，想不到 Avengers 也有失手的時候！
